item.title: Open Source Developments in Nanotechnology
item.text: Host and Moderator: Dr. Rajinder Khosla, NSF Program Director Panelists: Chuck Bouldin (NSF Program Director, DMR), Sandip Tiwari (Director NNIN), Gerhard Klimeck (NCN Associate Director) NSF nano Grantee's Meeting, Dec. 4th, 2007

item.title: Quantum Electronics
item.text: Host and Moderator: Dr. Gerhard Klimeck, Panelists: Kang Wang, Dragica Vasileska, Dmitri Nikonov, and Susan Coppersmith, NSF Workshop on Quantum, Molecular and High Performance Modeling and Simulation for Devices and Systems (QMHP), April 17, 2007.

item.title: Cyber Infrastructure Roundtable Discussion, Host and Moderator: Ahmed Elmagarmid, Director Cyber Center
item.text: Panelists: Brian Wilson (SUN micorsystems, CTO), Gerhard Klimeck, Rudolf Eigenmann, David Ebert, Thomas J. Hacker

item.title: Nano Frontiers Workshop
item.text: by invitation only, Meeting sponsored by NSF, NIH, Pew Charitable Trust, Wilson Center for International Scholars, Feb. 9-10, 2006.

item.title: Panel Discussion: Nanotechnology in the Americas
item.text: GNN 2005, 3rd International Workshop to Develop a Global Nanotechnology Network, May 25-27, 2005, Saarbrücken, Germany.

item.title: Panel discussion: Interaction with Industry
item.text: 2004 NSF Nanoscale Science and Engineering Grantees Conference, Washington, DC, Dec. 15, 2004.

item.title: Opportunities on International Collaborations on Grid Computing
item.text: Grid Forum Korea (GFK) Summer Workshop, Seoul, Korea, Aug. 26-27, 2004, Moderator: Prof. Chan-Hyun Youn (ICU, Korea).

item.title: Bird of a Feather Panel on HPC Innovation for Nanotechnology
item.text: Supercomputing Conference 2003, Phoenix, AZ, November 16-21, 2003, Moderator: Dr. David Kahaner (ATIP, Japan).

item.title: Software Development at Academia, Government Labs, Industry
item.text: John Barker Agenda/Questions: How can the three share development? Possibly cooperation like designer chemistry software? What are the technical challenges? What is the software we are talking about anyways?, Glasgow, Scotland, UK, May 22-25, 2000, Moderator: Prof. John Barker (U. of Glasgow).
